FAO: $LINK MARINES  The memes have and always will be a part of $LINK culture, however, as @chainlink elevates its position and becomes the industry standard #oracle, its crucial that we elevate the tone of our interactions.  Becoming a standard is about acting like the standard.

@LINKNewsOracle Agreed, bend the knee memes were funny when we were an underdog, but it's become abundantly clear that chainlink is the industry standard, and we should start acting as such  Never stop memeing though, that's in our culture, but meme in good taste my frens

It's plain to see that #chainlink has been very successful so far and it is gaining a place of respect within the industry.     I understand the power of memes but I think it's time we start to retire a few.  "Bend the Knee" & "Stay poor" are good examples that are probably in

bad taste.  Do we really want to reward a platform that was once considered a competitor to #chainlink to the ecosystem with an endless stream of tweets congratulating them for "bending the knee"?   That's the kind of stuff that makes people dig in their heels and refuse.

This is due to some experiences they had with our community before they fully understood the benefits that #chainlink brings to their platform.  I think we need to take a step back and look at our interactions and decide if that is the perception we want to give of #chainlink.

Memes are an essential part of $LINK culture so don't get the idea that we shouldn't meme things but we should elevate the discourse by memeing ideas rather than the people and projects behind them.     #Chainlink is no longer a relatively unknown project struggling for
